articles.title: Instructor and TA
articles.description: This blog includes content for the Fall 2021 section of EPsy 8264.
articles.contents: Instructor: Andrew Zieffler Email: zief0002@umn.edu Physical Office: Education Sciences Building 178 Office Hours: Wednesday 9:00 AM–10:00 AM; and by appointment Virtual Office: If you want to meet virtually, send me a Google calendar invite and include a Zoom link.

articles.title: Assignments
articles.contents:
Below are the due dates for the assignments, as well as links to each assignment. The due dates may change at the instructor’s discretion. Any revised due dates will be announced in class and posted to the website.

Due: Sept. 28 Link: Post

Assignment 02: Simulating from the Regression Model
Due: Oct. 07 Link:

Assignment 03: Regression Diagnostics
Due: Oct. 14 Link:

Assignment 04: Using WLS to Model Data with Outliers
Due: Oct. 21 Link:

Assignment 05: Variable Reduction
Due: Nov. 02 Link:

Assignment 06: Shrinkage Methods

Assignment 08: Bootstrapping and Prediction

articles.title: EPsy 8264
articles.contents:
Welcome
Welcome to EPsy 8264: Advanced Multiple Regression Analysis. This is an advanced seminar for doctoral students in education covering a diverse set of regression methodologies. We will begin with a brief review of the General Linear Model and establishment of a mathematical foundation for the estimation of regression coefficients and standard errors in these models through the use of matrix algebra. The course will also cover more advanced modeling techniques, such as regression diagnostics, WLS and sandwich estimation, PCA, shrinkage methods, model selection and local models.



Classroom
Tuesday/Thursday (9:45–11:00): Appleby Hall 102

Syllabus
The course syllabus is available here.
Message from Snoop Dogg about the syllabus

Textbooks
The course textbook is available via the University of Minnesota library.
Fox, J. (2013). A mathematical primer for social statistics. Sage.
